column1: What's the value of the following determinant $\begin{vmatrix} a & b + c & a^{2} \\ b & c + a & b^{2} \\ c & a + b & c^{2} \end{vmatrix}$
column2: the answer is -(a + b - c)(a - b)(b - c)(c - a)

column1: What's the value of the following determinant $\begin{vmatrix} \sqrt{13} + \sqrt{3} & 2\cdot \sqrt{5} & \sqrt{5} \\ \sqrt{15} + \sqrt{26} & 5 & \sqrt{10} \\ 3 + \sqrt{65} & \sqrt{15} & 5 \end{vmatrix}$
What's the value of the following determinant $\begin{vmatrix} x & x(x^{2} + 1) & x + 1 \\ y & y(y^{2} + 1) & y + 1 \\ z & z(z^{2} + 1) & z + 1 \end{vmatrix}$
column2: the answer is (x + y + z)(x - y)(y - z)(z - x)

column1: If x, y and z are respectively l th 2m th and 3 nth term of an H.P, then what's value of the following determinant
The determinant $\begin{vmatrix} 1 & a^{2} & a^{3} \\ 1 & b^{2} & b^{3} \\ 1 & c^{2} & c^{3} \end{vmatrix}$ is euivalent to
column2: the answer is $(ab + bc + ca)\cdot \begin{vmatrix} 1 & a & a^{2} \\ 1 & b & b^{2} \\ 1 & c & c^{2} \end{vmatrix}$
column4: $(ab + bc + ca)\cdot \begin{vmatrix} 1 & a & a^{2} \\ 1 & b & b^{2} \\ 1 & c & c^{2} \end{vmatrix}$
column5: $-(ab + bc + ca)\cdot \begin{vmatrix} 1 & a & a^{2} \\ 1 & b & b^{2} \\ 1 & c & c^{2} \end{vmatrix}$
column6: $abc\cdot \begin{vmatrix} 1 & a & a^{2} \\ 1 & b & b^{2} \\ 1 & c & c^{2} \end{vmatrix}$
column8: $(ab + bc + ca)\cdot \begin{vmatrix} 1 & a & a^{2} \\ 1 & b & b^{2} \\ 1 & c & c^{2} \end{vmatrix}$

column1: Find value of the following determinant $\begin{vmatrix} x! & (x + 1)! & (x + 2)! \\ (x + 1)! & (x + 2)! & (x + 3)! \\ (x + 2)! & (x + 3)! & (x + 4)! \end{vmatrix}$
Find the value of the following determinant $\begin{vmatrix} (b + c)^{2} & a^{2} & b\cdot c \\ (c + a)^{2} & b^{2} & c\cdot a \\ (a + b)^{2} & c^{2} & a\cdot b \end{vmatrix}$
column2: the answer is $(a^{2} + b^{2} + c^{2})(a + b + c)(a - b)(b - c)(c - a)$

column1: Find the value of the following determinant $\begin{vmatrix} x^{2} & x^{2} - (y - z)^{2} & y\cdot z \\ y^{2} & - (z - x)^{2} & z\cot x \\ z^{2} & z^{2} - (x - y)^{2} & a\cdot b \end{vmatrix}$
column2: the answer is $(x^{2} + y^{2} + z^{2})(x + y + z)(x - y)(y - z)(z - x)$

column1: If $a_{1}b_{1}c_{1}$, $a_{2}b_{2}c_{2}$ and $a_{3}b_{3}c_{3}$ are 3 three digit numbers, each of which is divisible by k then the determinant $\begin{vmatrix} a_{1} & b_{1} & c_{1} \\ a_{2} & b_{2} & c_{2} \\ a_{3} & b_{3} & c_{3} \end{vmatrix}$ is divisible by

If $a_{i}, b_{i}, c_{i}\in \mathbb{R} (i= 1, 2, 3)$ and $x\in \mathbb{R}$ then $\begin{vmatrix} a_{1} + b{1}x & a_{1}x + b_{1} & c_{1} \\ a_{2} + b_{2}x & a_{2}x + b_{2} & c_{2} \\ a_{3} + b_{3}x & a_{3}x + b_{3} & c_{3} \end{vmatrix}$
column2: the answer is $(1 - x^{2})\cdot \begin{vmatrix} a_{1} & b_{1} & c_{1} \\ a_{2} & b_{2} & c_{2} \\ a_{3} & b_{3} & c_{3} \end{vmatrix}$

column1: If a, b, c are the roots of the equation $px^{3} + qx^{2} + rx + s$, then the value of $\begin{vmatrix} 1 + a & 1 & 1 \\ 1 & 1 + b & 1 \\ 1 & 1 & 1 + c \end{vmatrix}$

If a, b, c are distinct and $\begin{vmatrix} a & a^{3} & a^{4} - 1 \\ b & b^{3} & b^{4} - 1 \\ c & c^{3} & c^{4} - 1 \end{vmatrix}= 0$ then,
column2: the answer is $abc\cdot (ab + bc + ca)= a + b + c$

column1: What's the value of the following determinant $\begin{vmatrix} \frac{1}{a + x} & \frac{1}{a + y) & 1 \\ \frac{1}{b + x} & \frac{1}{b + y) & 1 \\ \frac{1}{c + x} & \frac{1}{c + y) & 1 \end{vmatrix}$
column2: the answer is $\frac{(a - b)(a - c)(b - c)(x - y)}{(a + x)(b + x)(c + x)(a + y)(b + y)(c + y)}$

column1: What's the value of the following determinant $\begin{vmatrix} a^{2} & bc & ac + c^{2} \\ a^{2} + ab & b^{2} & ac \\ ab & b^{2} + bc & c^{2} \end{vmatrix}$
column2: the answer is $4\cdot a^{2}\cdot b^{2}\cdot c^{2}$

column1: Find the value of the following determinant $\begin{vmatrix} 1 + a^{2} - b^{2} & 2ab & -2b \\ 2ab & 1 - a^{2} + b^{2} & 2c \\ 2b & -2a & 1 - a^{2} - b^{2} \end{vmatrix}$

If a, b, c are the sides of a triangle and p denotes it perimeter, s half of it's perimeter and A it's area, then $\begin{vmatrix} a^{2} & (s - a)^{2} & (s - a)^{2} \\ (s - b)^{2} & b^{2} & (s - b)^{2} \\ (s - c)^{2} & (s - c)^{2} & c^{2} \end{vmatrix}$
